item.title: Brad Lander Is Arrested by ICE Agents at Immigration Courthouse
item.description: Mr. Lander, the New York City comptroller and a candidate for mayor, was handcuffed as he tried to steer a man past Immigration and Customs Enforcemen...

item.title: Bernie Sanders Endorses Zohran Mamdani for N.Y.C. Mayor
item.description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont backed Mr. Mamdani, joining Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in endorsing the front-runner of progressives.

item.title: Alfred Brendel, Bravura Pianist Who Forged a Singular Path, Dies at 94
item.description: With little formal training but full of ideas, he focused on the core classical composers, winning over audiences (though not every critic) worldwide.

item.title: Was Basketball Invented in Herkimer, NY? The Human Calculator Thinks So.
item.description: The official story is that Dr. James Naismith invented basketball in Springfield, Mass., in 1891. But what about the teenager tossing cabbages in upst...

item.title: Book Review: ‘Not My Type,’ by E. Jean Carroll
item.description: Her lawyers urged that she keep her testimony short. With legal victories in hand, she’s sharing her life story, and what it was like on the stand.
